raw_response: {"answer_index": 3, "answer_text": "Sensorineural hearing loss", "confidence": 10, "reasoning": "Congenital cytomegalovirus (CMV) infection is a well-known cause of sensorineural hearing loss in children. While mental retardation (now termed intellectual disability) can occur, the most characteristic and common sequela is sensorineural hearing loss. Renal failure and hepatic fibrosis are not typical late sequelae of congenital CMV infection.", "evidence_quality": "normal"}
